structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Property which cities may acquire -- Methods of acquisition -- Title in city.
law.text: Any city that establishes a recreational project may purchase solely from the funds provided under the authority of KRS 97.100 to 97.240, or may acquire by gift, devise, bequest or grant, lands, structures, rights of way, franchises, easements or other interests in land necessary for the establishment and maintenance of the project, upon such terms, prices and considerations as the city considers reasonable. Title to all property acquired for such purposes shall be taken in the name of the city.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2741p-16.
